New Records: Orlando Magic guard Cole Anthony scored a season-high 24 points
New York Knicks forward Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges each scored 24 points
Key Match Events: The Orlando Magic limited the New York Knicks to 4-for-22 shooting from three-point range in the second half
The Knicks challenged a foul call but couldn't score
The Magic avoided a four-game sweep by winning the final meeting
Pre-Game Insights: New York Knicks center Karl-Anthony Towns sat out due to right knee pain
Orlando Magic players stepped up with contributions from multiple players despite several injuries
Post-Match Reflections: The New York Knicks struggled without Karl-Anthony Towns, impacting their offensive flow
The Orlando Magic showed defensive intensity which helped them secure the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the final meeting between the two teams, keeping the overall series lead at 68-66
The Knicks are dealing with a season-high third straight loss
